tools.comment: Reads the complete (or partial) contents of a file as text, with optional head/tail line limiting (deprecated in favor of read_text_file).
Reads the complete or partial contents of a text file from the filesystem, handling various encodings.
Reads an image or audio file and returns its base64-encoded data along with its MIME type.
Reads the contents of multiple files simultaneously, returning each file's content keyed by its path.
Creates a new file or completely overwrites an existing file with the provided text content.
Makes targeted line-based edits to an existing text file by replacing exact text sequences, returning a git-style diff.
Creates a new directory (including any necessary parent directories) or silently succeeds if it already exists.
Lists all files and directories at the specified path, distinguishing entries with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes.
Lists all files and directories at a specified path including their sizes, with optional sorting by name or size.
Recursively returns a JSON tree structure of all files and directories under the specified path, with optional exclusion patterns.
Moves or renames a file or directory from a source path to a destination path, deleting the source upon success.
Recursively searches for files and directories matching a glob-style pattern under a given root path, returning full matching paths.
Retrieves detailed metadata (size, timestamps, permissions, type) about a file or directory without reading its content.
Returns the list of directories this server is permitted to access, requiring no arguments.
Stages specified files in the working directory for the next commit.
Shows line-by-line authorship information for a file, revealing who last modified each line.
Lists, creates, deletes, or renames git branches in the repository.
Gathers git history context and structured review instructions to support LLM-driven changelog analysis.
Switches branches, restores working tree files, or creates a new branch in the repository.
Applies specific commits from other branches onto the current branch.
Removes untracked files (and optionally directories) from the working directory.
Clears the session working directory setting, requiring explicit paths for subsequent git operations.
Clones a remote git repository to a local path, optionally with shallow cloning or specific branch.
Creates a new commit with staged changes and a commit message in the repository.
Shows differences between commits, branches, or the working tree in unified diff format.
Fetches updates from a remote repository, downloading objects and refs without merging.
Initializes a new git repository at the specified path, creating the .git directory.
Views commit history with optional filtering by author, date range, file path, or message pattern.
Merges another branch into the current branch with optional merge strategies.
Fetches and integrates changes from a remote repository into the current branch.
Uploads local commits to a remote repository branch, with options for force push and branch deletion.
Reapplies commits on top of another base tip to produce a cleaner linear history.
Views the reference logs to track when branch tips and other refs were updated, useful for recovering lost commits.
Manages remote repositories by listing, adding, removing, renaming, or updating remote URLs.
Resets the current HEAD to a specified state, optionally discarding staged or working tree changes.
Sets the session working directory so subsequent git commands can omit the path parameter.
Displays details and diff of a git object such as a commit, tree, blob, or tag.
Manages stashes by listing, saving, restoring, or removing stashed working directory changes.
Shows the working tree status including staged, unstaged, and untracked files.
Manages tags by listing, creating, or deleting tags that mark specific points in history.
Manages multiple git working trees by listing, adding, removing, moving, or pruning worktrees.
Returns the user's desired git wrap-up workflow instructions along with current repository status to guide next commit actions.
Fetches content from a specified URL via HTTP GET and returns it in a configurable format.
Searches the web using a configured search provider and returns a list of results for the given query.
Adds a review comment to the requester's latest pending pull request review on a specific file path.
Adds a comment to a specific issue or pull request in a GitHub repository.
Adds a reply to an existing pull request comment, creating a threaded response.
Assigns GitHub Copilot to work on a specific issue, potentially resulting in an auto-generated pull request.
Creates a new branch in a GitHub repository, optionally from a specified source branch.
Creates or updates a single file in a GitHub repository on a specified branch.
Creates a new pull request in a GitHub repository from a head branch into a base branch.
Creates a new GitHub repository in the authenticated user's account or a specified organization.
Deletes a file from a specified branch in a GitHub repository.
Forks a GitHub repository to the authenticated user's account or a specified organization.
Retrieves details for a specific commit from a GitHub repository, optionally including diffs.
Retrieves the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository at an optional ref or SHA.
Retrieves details of a specific label from a GitHub repository.
Retrieves the latest release from a GitHub repository.
Retrieves profile details of the currently authenticated GitHub user.
Retrieves a specific release identified by its tag name from a GitHub repository.
Retrieves details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository.
Retrieves the member usernames of a specific team within a GitHub organization.
Retrieves the teams the authenticated user (or a specified user) is a member of.
Reads information about a specific GitHub issue, including details, comments, sub-issues, or labels.
Creates a new issue or updates an existing issue in a GitHub repository.
Lists all branches in a GitHub repository.
Lists commits on a branch or up to a specific SHA in a GitHub repository.
Lists the supported issue types configured for a GitHub organization.
Lists issues in a GitHub repository with optional filtering by state, labels, or date.
Lists pull requests in a GitHub repository with optional filtering by state, head, and base branch.
Lists all releases in a GitHub repository.
Lists all git tags in a GitHub repository.
Merges a pull request in a GitHub repository using a specified merge method.
Retrieves information about a specific pull request, including details, diffs, status, files, comments, or reviews.
Creates, submits, or deletes a pull request review on a GitHub repository.
Pushes multiple files to a GitHub repository branch in a single commit.
Requests an automated GitHub Copilot code review for a specified pull request.
Searches for code across GitHub repositories using GitHub's native code search syntax.
Searches for issues across GitHub repositories using GitHub's issue search syntax.
Searches for pull requests across GitHub repositories using GitHub's pull request search syntax.
Searches for GitHub repositories by name, description, topics, or other metadata.
Searches for GitHub users by username, name, or other profile information.
Adds, removes, or reprioritizes a sub-issue within a parent issue in a GitHub repository.
Updates an existing pull request's metadata such as title, body, state, base branch, or reviewers.
Updates a pull request's branch with the latest changes from its base branch.
